info.name: Tahsin App
info.description:
# ðŸš€ Get started here
<!--
This template guides you through CRUD operations (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE), variables, and tests.

## ðŸ”– **How to use this template**

#### **Step 1: Send requests**

RESTful APIs allow you to perform CRUD operations using the POST, GET, PUT, and DELETE HTTP methods.

This collection contains each of these [request](https://learning.postman.com/docs/sending-requests/requests/) types. Open each request and click "Send" to see what happens.

#### **Step 2: View responses**

Observe the response tab for status code (200 OK), response time, and size.

#### **Step 3: Send new Body data**

Update or add new data in "Body" in the POST request. Typically, Body data is also used in PUT request.

```
{
    "name": "Add your name in the body"
}

 ```

#### **Step 4: Update the variable**

Variables enable you to store and reuse values in Postman. We have created a [variable](https://learning.postman.com/docs/sending-requests/variables/) called `base_url` with the sample request [https://postman-api-learner.glitch.me](https://postman-api-learner.glitch.me). Replace it with your API endpoint to customize this collection.

#### **Step 5: Add tests in the "Scripts" tab**

Adding tests to your requests can help you confirm that your API is working as expected. You can write test scripts in JavaScript and view the output in the "Test Results" tab.

## ðŸ’ª Pro tips

- Use folders to group related requests and organize the collection.
    
- Add more [scripts](https://learning.postman.com/docs/writing-scripts/intro-to-scripts/) to verify if the API works as expected and execute workflows.
    

## ðŸ’¡Related templates

[API testing basics](https://go.postman.co/redirect/workspace?type=personal&collectionTemplateId=e9a37a28-055b-49cd-8c7e-97494a21eb54&sourceTemplateId=ddb19591-3097-41cf-82af-c84273e56719)  
[API documentation](https://go.postman.co/redirect/workspace?type=personal&collectionTemplateId=e9c28f47-1253-44af-a2f3-20dce4da1f18&sourceTemplateId=ddb19591-3097-41cf-82af-c84273e56719)  
[Authorization methods](https://go.postman.co/redirect/workspace?type=personal&collectionTemplateId=31a9a6ed-4cdf-4ced-984c-d12c9aec1c27&sourceTemplateId=ddb19591-3097-41cf-82af-c84273e56719)

-->

item.name: Auth

request.description:
# User Signup

This endpoint allows users to sign up by providing their username, email, and password.

## Request Body

- `username` (string) : The username of the user (min 3 char).
    
- `email` (string) : The email address of the user.
    
- `password` (string) : The password for the user account (min 6 char).

response.name: Failed - Email already access

request.description:
## Response

1. `accessToken` is used as a Bearer token in most requests
    
2. `refreshToken` is used to obtain a new access token when the current one expires.
The `POST /users/refresh` endpoint is used to refresh `accessToken`. This endpoint need a current `refreshToken` as a bearer token.

#### Response

The response will not contain any data, but will indicate the success or failure of the sign out operation.

### Update User

This endpoint allows an **admin** to update a user's information. Only **admin** users are permitted to perform this action.

#### Request Body

All of the request body parameters are optional.

- `email` (string, optional): The email address of the user.
    
- `password` (string, optional): The new password for the user account.
    
- `username` (string, optional): The username of the user.
    
- `role_id` (integer, optional): The ID of the user's role.
    

#### Response

The response contains a user model with the updated information.

### Delete User -- Role = Admin

This endpoint is used to delete a specific user from the system.

#### Response

The response will not include a body, but will return a status code to indicate the success or failure of the deletion operation.

request.description:
### Update Profile

This endpoint allows you to update a user's profile information.

#### Request

The request body is optional and can include the following fields:

- `name` (optional, string): The name of the user.
    
- `place_of_birth` (optional, string): The place of birth of the user.
    
- `date_of_birth` (optional, string): The date of birth of the user in the format YYYY-MM-DD.
    
- `address` (optional, string): The address of the user.
    
- `domicile` (optional, string): The domicile of the user.
    
- `phone_number` (optional, string): The phone number of the user.
    
- `profession` (optional, string): The profession of the user.

body.raw:
{
    "name": "Jhon Cena",
    "place_of_birth": "Bogor",

    "domicile": "Jakarta Barat",
    "phone_number": "086635615162",
    "profession": "Data Analysis"
}
